Build ID: I20070621-1340

Steps To Reproduce:
I created a SQL data set on Oracle 9 with a text column and two decimal columns.  I then created a cube with the text column as one group, a decimal column as the second group, and the sum of the other decimal column as the measurement.  When I then build a crosstab, and preview it, I get the error "java.math.BigDecimal cannot be cast to java.lang.Double."

More information:
I just found a related bug 155138.

I can not reproduce this problem. Could you please attach the report file and database schema?

I'm having trouble reproducing this now too.  If I have any luck, I'll put together a simple test case.

It had to do with my year dimension.  It was defined as a NUMBER coming from the database (defined by "EXTRACT (YEAR FROM the_date) AS the_year"), a Decimal in the Data Set, and a Decimal in the Data Cube.  When I changed the Data Set query to use "TO_CHAR(EXTRACT (YEAR FROM the_date)) AS the_year" the report worked fine.  The problem may have occurred when the_date was NULL.
The problem will occur when a member of a decimal group is NULL. Fix the bug.
